"The evidence shows a near-zero correlation between COVID safety and economic performance overall. Large portions of the outcome space however indicate a positive relation. In these regions, the shock effect dominates."

With more stringent policy measures in place, COVID-19 infections should be lower, even as economic performance is degraded. Thus, the correlation should be firmly negative between measures of economic performance and COVID social safety. https://t.co/zLhBAD7BCu

How did the world lose precious weeks when it should have been readying defenses against the coronavirus outbreak at least since January?

medium.com/@1DannyQuah/qu…
Day 76 — Brazil’s Jair Bolsonaro called the coronavirus “a media frenzy” and “a little flu”, criticising social isolation measures and the state governors who introduced them.

Day 56 — The US became the world’s lead nation in COVID-19 confirmed cases NYT.
Day 57 — Belarus’s President Alexander Lukashenko called the coronavirus a “frenzy and psychosis”, suggesting citizens “hit the sauna, down some vodka, and get back to work” (WP-2020.03)

Day 54 — Modi announced on TV at 2000h that from midnight all of India would be under lockdown; all markets closed; all transportation disallowed.
Day 55 — Trump suggested hydroxychloroquine as potential coronavirus treatment (CBS).

Day 47 — France strict nationwide lockdown; residents allowed out only for grocery shopping DW-Europe-lockdown
Day 49 — Number of COVID-19 deaths in Italy first exceeded those in China (CNN). Taiwan closes borders to noresidents.

Day +36 — US confirmed 402 new COVID-19 cases. Trump said, “Anybody that wants a test can get a test.” (CBS)
Day +41 — India’s Health Ministry said the coronavirus ‘is not a health emergency’.
Day +43 — US confirmed 2700 new cases. Trump declared national emergency (CBS)

Day +2 — Trump announced travel restrictions on people coming from China; US declared public health emergency (CBS).
Day +10 — Trump said, “The flu, in our country, kills from 25,000 people to 69,000 people a year,” suggesting the relative insignificance of the 15 COVID-19 cases

Day -6 — Lancet article on coronavirus by Chinese scientists describing pandemic potential and high mortality with evidence of efficient human transmission, and recommending testing upon suspicion and personal protective equipment for healthcare workers.

Day -17 — China top officials secretly determined likely facing pandemic from novel coronavirus in Wuhan (AP), but said nothing to the public. First case outside China recorded in Thailand (AP).
Day -16 — WHO tweeted ‘no clear evidence of human-to-human transmission in China’.

Day -19 — Chinese scientists published on open science networks — Virological.org and GenBank — the complete genome sequence of novel coronavirus (Horton). China’s NHC repeated its assertion of no evidence of human transmission and no medical worker infections.

This article only seeks to tabulate a relevant timeline on the beginnings of the coronavirus spread, WHO's actions, and the most visible responses across different economies. 

medium.com/@1DannyQuah/wh… https://t.co/HHPfuXjf29
2020.04.15 - Brazil's Jair Bolsonaro called the coronavirus "a media frenzy" and "a little flu", criticising social isolation measures and the state governors who introduced them.
2020.03.27 - Belarus's President Alexander Lukashenko called the coronavirus a "frenzy and psychosis", suggesting citizens "hit the sauna, down some vodka, and get back to work"

2020.03.25 - Trump suggests hydroxychloroquine as potential coronavirus treatment.

2020.03.26 - The US became the world's lead nation in COVID-19 confirmed cases

2020.03.09 - US has 959 confirmed cases. Trump compares mortality numbers on coronavirus and flu "So last year 37,000 Americans died from the common flu. It averages between 27,000 and 70,000 per year. Nothing is shut down, life & the economy go on.

2020.02.26 - Daily new cases outside China overtake those inside // Trump announces dedicated coronavirus response team lead by Mike Pence.

2020.03.09 - All of Italy placed on lockdown, the first European nation to do so.

2020.01.30 - WHO declares Public Health Emergency of International Concern

2020.02.09 - Trump said, "The flu, in our country, kills from 25,000 people to 69,000 people a year," suggesting the relative insignificance of the 15 COVID-19 cases thus far reported in the US
